cerMpegVideoMIB.name: cerMpegVideoMIB

revisions.description: Modify range of programs allowed on a channel.
Restrict virtual edge indexes to supported set.
Updated MIB SDV support for PSA v3.2
Updated MIB SDV support for PSA
Updated MIB SDV support for PSA v2.4
Updated MIB to E6000 IEQ Application PSA v2.1
Updated MIB to E6000 IEQ Application PSA v1.0
Updated MIB to match latest E6000 IEQ Application PSA for R3.0
Change default AutoGeneratePAT and AutoGeneratePMT to true.

cerMpegVideoMIB.contactinfo: Network Management Postal: Arris International. 4300 Cork Airport Business Park Cork Airport, Kinsale Road Cork, Ireland. Tel: +353 21 7305 800 Fax: +353 21 4321 972
cerMpegVideoMIB.description: This MIB manages the MPEG / VIDEO software on the Arris CER.

CerTransportStreamIndex.name: CerTransportStreamIndex
CerTransportStreamIndex.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies an MPEG Transport Stream in the E6000 MPEG Manager. This could represent an incoming or outgoing TS, or could represent an SPTS or MPTS.

CerElementaryStreamType.name: CerElementaryStreamType
CerElementaryStreamType.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG Elementary Stream Type values.

CerDescriptorTag.name: CerDescriptorTag
CerDescriptorTag.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG Descriptor Tags values.

CerDescriptorIndex.name: CerDescriptorIndex
CerDescriptorIndex.description: An identifier that uniquely identifies an MPEG Descriptor within a given Program or Elementary Stream.

CerDescriptorBuffer.name: CerDescriptorBuffer
CerDescriptorBuffer.description: A buffer that contains MPEG Descriptor data.

CerPID.name: CerPID
CerPID.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG PID values.

CerProgram.name: CerProgram
CerProgram.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG Program Number values.

CerPidType.name: CerPidType
CerPidType.description: A convenient type definition for PID - whether PSI or ES. PSI - the typical program defined by PAT & PMT tables ES - a stream that contains only PIDs with not references to PAT/PMT tables (si-stream) ghost - neither of the above, an unreferenced PID.

CerTransportStreamStatus.name: CerTransportStreamStatus
CerTransportStreamStatus.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG transport stream status states. These can be as follows active - currently passing video traffic blocked - no video passing currently, the stream is blocked inactive - not passing ANY traffic - used for statically configured streams

CerProgStatus.name: CerProgStatus
CerProgStatus.description: A convenient type definition for MPEG Program status states. These can be as follows active - currently passing video traffic timedOut - No video passing currently, in transition from active to inactive states inactive - not passing ANY traffic - used for statically configured programs

CerTransportStreamDirection.name: CerTransportStreamDirection
CerTransportStreamDirection.description: A convenient type definition for the direction of a Transport Stream incoming - the Transport Stream is being received by the E6000, typically over IP outgoing - the Transport Stream is being generated by the E6000 and sent to a QAM.

CerVirtualEdgeIndexType.name: CerVirtualEdgeIndexType
CerVirtualEdgeIndexType.description: A convenient type definition for the index associated with a Virtual Edge instance.

CerServiceGroupNameIndexType.name: CerServiceGroupNameIndexType
CerServiceGroupNameIndexType.description: A convenient type definition for the index associated with a video Service Group instance.

CerIeqQamType.name: CerIeqQamType
CerIeqQamType.description: The Type of IEQ QAM channel: vod - Video On Demand sdv - Switched Digital Video linear - Broadcast video vodsdv - VOD or SDV

CerUdpPortMapType.name: CerUdpPortMapType
CerUdpPortMapType.description: Defines the type of dataplane UDP port mapping used by a Virtual Edge as one of the following map8x8 - Static map: Upper 8 bits of UDP port determines the channel; lower 8 bits, the program number. map10x6 - Static map: Upper 10 bits of UDP port determines the channel; lower 6 bits, the program number. session - Mapping determined via ERM non-multicast session-based messages.

CerStreamType.name: CerStreamType
CerStreamType.description: Defines the type of stream in the UdpIpStream table static - Either a static UDP port map or manual map of a single port (future). dynamic - Set up via a message from a Session ERM. redundant - Redundant dynamic input stream set up via a message from a Session ERM (future).

CerPerChanEnable.name: CerPerChanEnable
CerPerChanEnable.description: A convenient type definition for per-channel feature configuration. These can be as follows enabled - the feature is enabled for this channel disabled - the feature is disabled for this channel global - the feature has no per-channel value, but uses the current global setting.

CerMulticastType.name: CerMulticastType
CerMulticastType.description: A convenient type definition for the multicast type for SDV/broadcast.

CerErmProtocolType.name: CerErmProtocolType
CerErmProtocolType.description: A convenient type definition for which type of protocol to use for communication with an ERM. ngod - Comcast Next Generation on Demand 2.0 protocol rpc - TWC Remote Procedure Call protocol rmi - CableLabs Remote Management Interface protocol none - No ERM will be used (e.g., manually configured table-based VOD only)

cervControlPatInterval.name: cervControlPatInterval
cervControlPatInterval.description: Retransmission interval for PAT tables in milliseconds.

cervControlPmtInterval.name: cervControlPmtInterval
cervControlPmtInterval.description: Retransmission interval for PMT tables in milliseconds.

cervControlUnicastTimeoutInterval.name: cervControlUnicastTimeoutInterval
cervControlUnicastTimeoutInterval.description: The unicast (VOD) TS timeout interval in seconds.

cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel.name: cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel
cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel.description: Max number of programs per channel. Without this parameter, with 8:8 port mapping, the maximum port value allowed would be 255. Since we can fit at least 10 SD programs on a video channel, should not allow setting below 10. The legal program number range for OTS program numbers is 1 to cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel.

cervControlOverSubscriptionRecovery.name: cervControlOverSubscriptionRecovery
cervControlOverSubscriptionRecovery.description: If this is set to TRUE, then the E6000 will attempt to recover automatically from a QAM-overscribed condition by shutting down active programs selectively. It selects which programs to shut down by order of most recently activated, checks the new bitrates, then continues to shutdown more programs as neccessary untill the total bandwidth fits within the QAM available bandwidth.

cervControlDuplicateTsidCheck.name: cervControlDuplicateTsidCheck
cervControlDuplicateTsidCheck.description: If this is set to never, then the E6000 disablse detection of duplicate TSIDs, allowing any pair of channels to use the same value. If it is set to streamingZone, the E6000 will check that TSIDs are unique within streaming zones. If set to serviceGroup, it will check that TSIDs are unique within service groups.

cervControlPreEncDetect.name: cervControlPreEncDetect
cervControlPreEncDetect.description: If this is set to TRUE, then the E6000 will detect pre-encrypted streams, and will avoid re-encrypting the traffic when forwarding it downstream.

cervControlOnProgConflictDropOld.name: cervControlOnProgConflictDropOld
cervControlOnProgConflictDropOld.description: If this is set to FALSE, if a new stream from a different source IP address maps to the same output QAM channel and program number as an existing stream, the E6000 will drop the newer stream and forward the older stream. If it is TRUE then the older stream will be blocked, and the newer one will be forwarded.

cervControlDefaultJitter.name: cervControlDefaultJitter
cervControlDefaultJitter.description: The default jitter buffer depth for a channel in milliseconds. Zero means do not compensate for jitter (i.e., send immediately).

cervControlUdpPortOffset.name: cervControlUdpPortOffset
cervControlUdpPortOffset.description: The low UDP port number in the block of 256 UDP ports assigned to a channel. cervControlUdpPortOffset plus cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel must be less than 257.

cervErmProtocol.name: cervErmProtocol
cervErmProtocol.description: The type of ERM protocol for ERM communications. Must be configured before configuring ERM parameters.

cervStaticVodPidRemapScheme.name: cervStaticVodPidRemapScheme
cervStaticVodPidRemapScheme.description: The type of PID remapping scheme to use to static (table-based) VOD. Session-based VOD is only allowed to use dynamic remapping.

cerVideoQamStreamTable.name: cerVideoQamStreamTable
cerVideoQamStreamTable.description: This table stores MPEG Video related data on a per QAM channel basis. Rows in this table are auto-created when a row of type dchannelVideo is created in the portTable. It is autodeleted when the row in the portTable is deleted.

cervQamTransportStreamID.name: cervQamTransportStreamID
cervQamTransportStreamID.description: The MPEG transport_stream_id used when transmitting PAT tables on this QAM channel. All QAM streams in the same streaming zone must have a unique TSID value, unless cervControlAllowTsidDuplication is set to true. A unique value is auto-populated when the row is created, although the value may be explicitly written to a different, unique value (with the SZ) at a later time.

cervQamTsMibIndex.name: cervQamTsMibIndex
cervQamTsMibIndex.description: The index of the outgoing Transport Stream on this QAM channel.

cervQamPatInterval.name: cervQamPatInterval
cervQamPatInterval.description: Retransmission interval for PAT tables in milliseconds. A value of zero means use the global value.

cervQamPmtInterval.name: cervQamPmtInterval
cervQamPmtInterval.description: Retransmission interval for PMT tables in milliseconds. A value of zero means use the global value.

cervQamOverSubscriptionRecoveryEnabled.name: cervQamOverSubscriptionRecoveryEnabled
cervQamOverSubscriptionRecoveryEnabled.description: If this is set to enabled, then the E6000 will attempt to recover automatically from a QAM-overscribed condition by shutting down active programs selectively. It selects which programs to shut down by order of most recently activated, checks the new bitrates, then continues to shutdown more programs as neccessary untill the total bandwidth fits within the QAM available bandwidth. If set to disabled, packets are discarded randomly. If set to global, then the current value of cervControlOverSubscriptionRecovery is used.

cervQamPreEncDetect.name: cervQamPreEncDetect
cervQamPreEncDetect.description: If this is set to enabled, then the E6000 will detect Motorola pre-encrypted streams, and will avoid re-encrypting the traffic when forwarding it downstream. If set to global, then the current value of cervControlPreEncDetect is used.

cervQamOnProgConflictDropOld.name: cervQamOnProgConflictDropOld
cervQamOnProgConflictDropOld.description: If this is set to enabled, if a new stream from a different source IP address maps to the same output QAM channel and program number as an existing stream, the newer stream will be forwarded, and the older stream will be blocked. If set to disabled, then the newer stream will be blocked, and the older, existing one will be forwarded. If set to global, then the current value of cervControlOnProgConflictDropOld is used.

cervQamServiceGroupName.name: cervQamServiceGroupName
cervQamServiceGroupName.description: The name of the Service Group that this QAM channel is assigned to. A null string means the channel is not assigned to any Service Group.

cervQamServiceGroupIndex.name: cervQamServiceGroupIndex
cervQamServiceGroupIndex.description: The index for the Service Group, required for session-based ERMs. Zero means the channel is not assigned to a service group.

cervQamVeqIndex.name: cervQamVeqIndex
cervQamVeqIndex.description: The index of the Virtual Edge that this QAM channel is assigned to. This value must be provided when the row is created and cannot be updated.

cervQamUdpBasePort.name: cervQamUdpBasePort
cervQamUdpBasePort.description: This attribute is only used when cervePortMap is set to 8x8 or 10x6. The start of the UDP port range is assigned to this QAM channel for the purposes of routing video traffic to it. There will be 256 ports assigned when using 8x8, or 64 when using 10x6 port mapping scheme. The lowest port number in each block is not used in the port map. Only the 8x8 mapping scheme is currently supported. Setting this value auto-populates a corresponding row in cerveUdpPortMapTable and, when the value is changed in an existing row, deletes the row in cerveUdpPortMapTable for the old value. The UDP block starting with zero is not usable; zero means no block is assigned.

cervQamJitterDepth.name: cervQamJitterDepth
cervQamJitterDepth.description: The setting for jitter-buffer depth in milliseconds for video program streams on this channel. Can be set to a small value to reduce latency through the box, or set to a higher value to compensate for more jitter in the input video stream. Uses the global value cervControlDefaultJitter when the value is -1

cervQamUdpPortOffset.name: cervQamUdpPortOffset
cervQamUdpPortOffset.description: The offset in the 256 UDP port block for the lowest numbered UDP port mapped to this channel. cervQamUdpPortOffset plus cervControlMaxProgramsPerQamChannel must be less than 257. Zero means uses the current global value cervControlUdpPortOffset.

cervQamClearCounters.name: cervQamClearCounters
cervQamClearCounters.description: Always reads as false. Setting it to true clears all IEQ video counters related to this DS channel. Setting it to false has no effect.

cervQamSubtype.name: cervQamSubtype
cervQamSubtype.description: The type(s) of Ieq traffic to be carried over this QAM channel. Used for reporting config to ERM session managers. Linear is not yet supported. Channels cannot be used for video if the subtype is none.

cerVideoQamStreamStateTable.name: cerVideoQamStreamStateTable
cerVideoQamStreamStateTable.description: This table provides MPEG Video status on a per QAM channel basis. Rows in this table are auto-created when a row of type dchannelVod, dchannelSdv, or dchannelBroadcast is created in the portTable. It is autodeleted when the row in the portTable is deleted.

cervQamTotalPatsTx.name: cervQamTotalPatsTx
cervQamTotalPatsTx.description: The total number of unique PAT Tables that have been generated for this QAM channel.

cervQamTotalProgramsTx.name: cervQamTotalProgramsTx
cervQamTotalProgramsTx.description: The accumulated number of Programs transmitted on this QAM channel.

cervQamCurrentProgramsTx.name: cervQamCurrentProgramsTx
cervQamCurrentProgramsTx.description: The number of Programs currently being transmitted on this QAM channel.

cervQamPeakProgramsTx.name: cervQamPeakProgramsTx
cervQamPeakProgramsTx.description: The peak number of Programs transmitted since the channel was activated.

cervQamStreamStatus.name: cervQamStreamStatus
cervQamStreamStatus.description: Current status of this QAM Transport stream

cervQamTimeActivated.name: cervQamTimeActivated
cervQamTimeActivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this stream was last activated. Zero if not-applicable.

cervQamTimeActive.name: cervQamTimeActive
cervQamTimeActive.description: The total time that MPEG stream has been active.

cervQamTimeDeactivated.name: cervQamTimeDeactivated
cervQamTimeDeactivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this stream was last deactivated. Zero if not-known.

cervQamOverSubscribed.name: cervQamOverSubscribed
cervQamOverSubscribed.description: Indicates if the bandwidth of this QAM is currently over-subscribed (receiving more packets than can be transmitted). If the QAM is currently over-subscribed, some programs will suffer packet-loss. The affected programs are identified in the cerQamProgramPcrBufferTable.

cervQamCurrentBandwidth.name: cervQamCurrentBandwidth
cervQamCurrentBandwidth.description: For table-based VOD,the current bandwidth in use. For Session-based VOD and SDV, the total requested bandwidth.

cervQamPeakBandwidth.name: cervQamPeakBandwidth
cervQamPeakBandwidth.description: For table-based VOD,the peak bandwidth in use since the channel was activated. For session-based VOD and SDV, the peak requested bandwidth since the channel was activated.

cerVideoReplicaChanTable.name: cerVideoReplicaChanTable
cerVideoReplicaChanTable.description: This Table contains one row for each replicated channel.

cervReplicaSourceIfIndex.name: cervReplicaSourceIfIndex
cervReplicaSourceIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the source (base) video channel.

cervReplicatedIfIndex.name: cervReplicatedIfIndex
cervReplicatedIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the replicated channel associated with this source video channel.

cervReplicaRowStatus.name: cervReplicaRowStatus
cervReplicaRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table.

cerveServiceGroupTable.name: cerveServiceGroupTable
cerveServiceGroupTable.description: This table contains a mapping, per VE, of RF connectors to SG names.

cerveServiceGroupEntry.name: cerveServiceGroupEntry
cerveServiceGroupEntry.description: Video service group configuration. A row in this table is created when the first channel on an RF connector is assigned to a SG. All channels on the same RF port (i.e., same slot and connector) and in the same VE must have the same SG name.

cerveServiceGroupSlot.name: cerveServiceGroupSlot
cerveServiceGroupSlot.description: The card slot plus one of the channel in this service group.

cerveServiceGroupConnector.name: cerveServiceGroupConnector
cerveServiceGroupConnector.description: The DS connector number plus one of the channel in this service group. Only 1..8 is legal for first generation DCAM.

cerveServiceGroupName.name: cerveServiceGroupName
cerveServiceGroupName.description: The name of the video Service Group.

cerveServiceGroupIndex.name: cerveServiceGroupIndex
cerveServiceGroupIndex.description: The index number for the SG, required for session-based ERMs. Set by assigning a SG index to a channel on this RF connector.

cerVideoUdpIpStreamTable.name: cerVideoUdpIpStreamTable
cerVideoUdpIpStreamTable.description: This table displays the current incoming Transport Streams that are to be forwarded to an active QAM channel. Only streams being forwarded are in this table. Entries contain a reference to either a specific QAM channel or to a channel-container. While not needed for uniqueness, the VE index is a key to allow us to easily find all streams in a VE.

cervUdpIpDestIpAddr.name: cervUdpIpDestIpAddr
cervUdpIpDestIpAddr.description: The DEST IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified QAM Channel.

cervUdpIpDestUdpPort.name: cervUdpIpDestUdpPort
cervUdpIpDestUdpPort.description: The destination UDP Port of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified QAM Channel.

cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr.name: cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr
cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr.description: The SRC IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified QAM Channel.

cervUdpIpTsMibIndex.name: cervUdpIpTsMibIndex
cervUdpIpTsMibIndex.description: The index of the entry in the cerVideoStreamTable corresponding to this table entry.

cervUdpIpActiveQamIfIndex.name: cervUdpIpActiveQamIfIndex
cervUdpIpActiveQamIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the table-based QAM channel that this stream is currently mapped to. This is zero if the input stream is session-based and therefore is mapped to a channel container. Only one of cervUdpIpActiveQamIfIndex and cervUdpIpChanContainer are set for any single input stream.

cervUdpIpTimeActivated.name: cervUdpIpTimeActivated
cervUdpIpTimeActivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this stream was last activated. Zero if not-applicable.

cervUdpIpTimeActive.name: cervUdpIpTimeActive
cervUdpIpTimeActive.description: The total time that the stream has been active.

cervUdpIpTimeDeactivated.name: cervUdpIpTimeDeactivated
cervUdpIpTimeDeactivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this stream was last deactivated.

cervUdpIpPacketCount.name: cervUdpIpPacketCount
cervUdpIpPacketCount.description: The number of UDP packets received for this stream.

cervUdpIpBadSyncCount.name: cervUdpIpBadSyncCount
cervUdpIpBadSyncCount.description: The number of ingress MPEG frames (TSPs)without the MPEG Sync byte. Since there can be multiple MPEG frames per UDP packet, this count could be higher than cervUdpIpPacketCount.

cervUdpIpChanContainer.name: cervUdpIpChanContainer
cervUdpIpChanContainer.description: The channel container for this session-based input stream. This is zero if the input stream is mapped using table-based VOD. Only one of cervUdpIpActiveQamIfIndex and cervUdpIpChanContainer is set for any single input stream.

cervUdpIpPidPassthruEnable.name: cervUdpIpPidPassthruEnable
cervUdpIpPidPassthruEnable.description: Whether or not to remap the PIDs in this stream. True means no remap.

cervUdpIpStreamType.name: cervUdpIpStreamType
cervUdpIpStreamType.description: If dynamic, then a message to the session ERM is needed if the stream fails.

cerVideoStreamTable.name: cerVideoStreamTable
cerVideoStreamTable.description: This table stores basic information on all Transport Streams in the E6000. It covers both incoming and outgoing ones. The MPEG Manager automatically creates any entry in this table when it detects a new incoming TS or begins to generate a new outgoing TS.

cervStreamDirectionIndex.name: cervStreamDirectionIndex
cervStreamDirectionIndex.description: The direction of this Transport Stream.

cervStreamTsMibIndex.name: cervStreamTsMibIndex
cervStreamTsMibIndex.description: The unique index that identifies the Transport Stream within the E6000.

cervStreamPatVersion.name: cervStreamPatVersion
cervStreamPatVersion.description: The version number of the current PAT Table for this Transport Stream.

cervStreamTsID.name: cervStreamTsID
cervStreamTsID.description: The MPEG transport_stream_id in the PAT tables on this Transport Stream.

cervStreamProgramCount.name: cervStreamProgramCount
cervStreamProgramCount.description: The number of Programs currently in this Transport Stream.

cervStreamPatCurrTimeCreated.name: cervStreamPatCurrTimeCreated
cervStreamPatCurrTimeCreated.description: The value of sysUpTime when the current PAT was created. Zero if not-applicable.

cervStreamPatCurrTimeActive.name: cervStreamPatCurrTimeActive
cervStreamPatCurrTimeActive.description: The total time the current PAT has been active.

cervStreamPatPrevTimeCreated.name: cervStreamPatPrevTimeCreated
cervStreamPatPrevTimeCreated.description: The value of sysUpTime when the predecessor of this PAT was created. Zero if not-known.

cervStreamProgramFilteredCount.name: cervStreamProgramFilteredCount
cervStreamProgramFilteredCount.description: The number of Programs currently being filtered from this Transport Stream.

cervStreamPidCount.name: cervStreamPidCount
cervStreamPidCount.description: The total number of PIDs used by this Transport Stream. It is the sum of all Program cervStreamProgEsCount + PMT PIDs + ECM PIDs (if present) + PCR PIDs (if different) + ghost PIDs (if present).

cervStreamTspCount.name: cervStreamTspCount
cervStreamTspCount.description: The total number of MPEG Transport Stream Packets sent/received on this stream.

cervStreamDroppedTspCount.name: cervStreamDroppedTspCount
cervStreamDroppedTspCount.description: The total number of MPEG Transport Stream Packets dropped on this stream.

cerVideoStreamProgramTable.name: cerVideoStreamProgramTable
cerVideoStreamProgramTable.description: This table stores basic information for each Program in each Transport Stream known to the E6000. Each entry in cerVideoStreamTable will have at least one entry in this table.

cervStreamProgTsMibIndex.name: cervStreamProgTsMibIndex
cervStreamProgTsMibIndex.description: The unique index that identifies the Transport Stream containing this Program.

cervStreamProgIndex.name: cervStreamProgIndex
cervStreamProgIndex.description: The Program Number for this program within the associated Transport Stream.

cervStreamProgPmtVersion.name: cervStreamProgPmtVersion
cervStreamProgPmtVersion.description: The version number of the current PMT Table for this Program.

cervStreamProgPmtPid.name: cervStreamProgPmtPid
cervStreamProgPmtPid.description: The MPEG PID used for the PMT Table for this Program.

cervStreamProgEcmPid.name: cervStreamProgEcmPid
cervStreamProgEcmPid.description: The MPEG PID used to for the ECM Table for this Program. This is set to 0 in the program is unencrypted.

cervStreamProgPcrPid.name: cervStreamProgPcrPid
cervStreamProgPcrPid.description: The MPEG PID used to for the PCR for this Program.

cervStreamProgEsCount.name: cervStreamProgEsCount
cervStreamProgEsCount.description: The number of Elementary Streams currently in this Program.

cervStreamProgDescCount.name: cervStreamProgDescCount
cervStreamProgDescCount.description: The number of Descriptors in the PMT 'first_loop' for this Program.

cervStreamPmtCurrTimeCreated.name: cervStreamPmtCurrTimeCreated
cervStreamPmtCurrTimeCreated.description: The value of sysUpTime when the current PMT was created. Zero if not-applicable.

cervStreamPmtCurrTimeActive.name: cervStreamPmtCurrTimeActive
cervStreamPmtCurrTimeActive.description: The total time the current PMT has been active.

cervStreamPmtPrevTimeCreated.name: cervStreamPmtPrevTimeCreated
cervStreamPmtPrevTimeCreated.description: The value of sysUpTime when the predecessor of this PMT was created. Zero if not-known.

cervStreamProgBitrate.name: cervStreamProgBitrate
cervStreamProgBitrate.description: The bitate in Kbps, of this Program. This may have a value of 0 if the bitrate is not known.

cervStreamProgPidFilteredCnt.name: cervStreamProgPidFilteredCnt
cervStreamProgPidFilteredCnt.description: The number of PIDs currently being filtered from this Program.

cervStreamProgContinuityErrCnt.name: cervStreamProgContinuityErrCnt
cervStreamProgContinuityErrCnt.description: The continuity-counter errors seen on PIDs in this Program

cerVideoStreamEsTable.name: cerVideoStreamEsTable
cerVideoStreamEsTable.description: This table stores basic information for each Elementary Stream in each Transport Stream known to the E6000. Each entry in cerVideoProgTable will have at least one entry in this table. These entries are created automatically as the E6000 processes PMT table entries for each Elementary Stream in a Program

cervStreamEsTsMibIndex.name: cervStreamEsTsMibIndex
cervStreamEsTsMibIndex.description: The unique index that identifies the Transport Stream containing this Program.

cervStreamEsProgIndex.name: cervStreamEsProgIndex
cervStreamEsProgIndex.description: The Program Number for the program containing this ES.

cervStreamEsPidIndex.name: cervStreamEsPidIndex
cervStreamEsPidIndex.description: The MPEG PID used for this Elementary Stream.

cervStreamEsType.name: cervStreamEsType
cervStreamEsType.description: The type of this Elementary Streams.

cervStreamEsDescCount.name: cervStreamEsDescCount
cervStreamEsDescCount.description: The number of Descriptors in the PMT 'second_loop' for this Elementary Stream.

cervStreamEsContinuityErrCnt.name: cervStreamEsContinuityErrCnt
cervStreamEsContinuityErrCnt.description: The continuity-counter errors seen on this PID.

cervStreamEsTspCount.name: cervStreamEsTspCount
cervStreamEsTspCount.description: The number of MPEG frames (TSPs) seen on this PID.

cerVideoStreamDataEsTable.name: cerVideoStreamDataEsTable
cerVideoStreamDataEsTable.description: This table stores basic information for each data-only Elementary Stream in each Transport Stream known to the E6000. For is one row for each ghost-pid, whether or not it is being forwarded.

cervStreamDataEsTsMibIndex.name: cervStreamDataEsTsMibIndex
cervStreamDataEsTsMibIndex.description: The unique index that identifies the Transport Stream containing this Program.

cervStreamDataEsPidIndex.name: cervStreamDataEsPidIndex
cervStreamDataEsPidIndex.description: The MPEG PID used for this Elementary Stream.

cervStreamDataEsIsGhostPid.name: cervStreamDataEsIsGhostPid
cervStreamDataEsIsGhostPid.description: True if this is a ghost PID. False if it is an si-stream PID (not supported yet).

cervStreamDataEsForwarding.name: cervStreamDataEsForwarding
cervStreamDataEsForwarding.description: True is we are forwarding this PID. False if we are dropping it.

cervStreamDataEsContinuityErrCnt.name: cervStreamDataEsContinuityErrCnt
cervStreamDataEsContinuityErrCnt.description: The continuity-counter errors seen on this PID.

cerVideoStreamDescTable.name: cerVideoStreamDescTable
cerVideoStreamDescTable.description: This table stores MPEG Descriptors for each Elementary Stream and Program known to the E6000. The PMT PID is used to index Program Descriptors while the Elementary Stream PID is used when indexing ES Descriptors.

cervStreamDescTsMibIndex.name: cervStreamDescTsMibIndex
cervStreamDescTsMibIndex.description: The unique index that identifies the Transport Stream containing this Descriptor.

cervStreamDescPidIndex.name: cervStreamDescPidIndex
cervStreamDescPidIndex.description: The MPEG PID used for this Elementary Stream.

cerVideoQamJitterStatusTable.name: cerVideoQamJitterStatusTable
cerVideoQamJitterStatusTable.description: This Table contains status information about the QAM dejitter buffers on a per-program basis. Entries in this table only persist for the life-time of the active programs, and are created & deleted on the fly as programs are shutdown & restarted.

cervQamJitterStatusIfIndex.name: cervQamJitterStatusIfIndex
cervQamJitterStatusIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the QAM channel associated with this entry.

cervQamJitterStatusProgNumber.name: cervQamJitterStatusProgNumber
cervQamJitterStatusProgNumber.description: The output program number associated with this entry.

cervQamJitterStatusCurrStatus.name: cervQamJitterStatusCurrStatus
cervQamJitterStatusCurrStatus.description: The status of the jitter buffer for this program. idle - waiting for input TS packets init - transmitting TS packets at nominal rate, not locked to incoming PCR active - normal passing traffic, locked to incoming PCR freeRunning - normal passing traffic, no PCR to lock to

cervQamJitterStatusUnderflowCnt.name: cervQamJitterStatusUnderflowCnt
cervQamJitterStatusUnderflowCnt.description: Number of times the jitter buffer has underflowed during the lifetime of this program.

cervQamJitterStatusOverflowCnt.name: cervQamJitterStatusOverflowCnt
cervQamJitterStatusOverflowCnt.description: Number of times the jitter buffer has overflowed during the lifetime of this program.

cervQamJitterStatusBufLength.name: cervQamJitterStatusBufLength
cervQamJitterStatusBufLength.description: The current size of the jitter buffer for this program in milliseconds.

cervQamJitterStatusPcrJitter.name: cervQamJitterStatusPcrJitter
cervQamJitterStatusPcrJitter.description: The estimate of the current network jitter.

cervQamJitterStatusPcrCnt.name: cervQamJitterStatusPcrCnt
cervQamJitterStatusPcrCnt.description: The total number of PCR samples processed in this program.

cervQamJitterStatusPcrDiscontinuityCnt.name: cervQamJitterStatusPcrDiscontinuityCnt
cervQamJitterStatusPcrDiscontinuityCnt.description: The total number of PCR discontinuities observed in this program.

cervQamJitterStatusBufDepth.name: cervQamJitterStatusBufDepth
cervQamJitterStatusBufDepth.description: The initial jitter-buffer depth in milliseconds for this program stream. May have been dynamically set via R6 NGOD interface.

cerVideoProgRemapTable.name: cerVideoProgRemapTable
cerVideoProgRemapTable.description: This table displays the active Program mappings for Transport Streams. It is indexed using udp/ip/ip/inProg/qamIfIndex to support multiple output programs for each input program.

cerVideoProgRemapEntry.name: cerVideoProgRemapEntry
cerVideoProgRemapEntry.description: Program to transport stream mapping table

cervProgRemapTsMibIndex.name: cervProgRemapTsMibIndex
cervProgRemapTsMibIndex.description: The TS Mib Index of the incoming TS.

cervProgRemapInProgIndex.name: cervProgRemapInProgIndex
cervProgRemapInProgIndex.description: The incoming Program value related to this Program remapping.

cervProgRemapActiveQamIfIndex.name: cervProgRemapActiveQamIfIndex
cervProgRemapActiveQamIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the QAM channel that this Program remapping applies to.

cervProgRemapOutProg.name: cervProgRemapOutProg
cervProgRemapOutProg.description: The output Program value related to this Program mapping rule.

cervProgRemapTimeActivated.name: cervProgRemapTimeActivated
cervProgRemapTimeActivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this Program was last activated. Zero if not-applicable.

cervProgRemapTimeActive.name: cervProgRemapTimeActive
cervProgRemapTimeActive.description: The total time that the Program has been active.

cerVideoPidRemapTable.name: cerVideoPidRemapTable
cerVideoPidRemapTable.description: This table displays the active PID mappings for Transport Streams. It is indexed using udp/ip/ip/inPid/qamIfIndex to support multiple output programs for each input program.

cerVideoPidRemapEntry.name: cerVideoPidRemapEntry
cerVideoPidRemapEntry.description: PID to transport stream mapping table

cervPidRemapTsMibIndex.name: cervPidRemapTsMibIndex
cervPidRemapTsMibIndex.description: The TS Mib Index of the incoming TS.

cervPidRemapInPidIndex.name: cervPidRemapInPidIndex
cervPidRemapInPidIndex.description: The incoming PID value related to this PID remapping.

cervPidRemapActiveQamIfIndex.name: cervPidRemapActiveQamIfIndex
cervPidRemapActiveQamIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the QAM channel that this PID remapping applies to.

cervPidRemapOutPid.name: cervPidRemapOutPid
cervPidRemapOutPid.description: The output PID value related to this PID mapping rule.

cervPidRemapActivePidType.name: cervPidRemapActivePidType
cervPidRemapActivePidType.description: The type of PID whether PSI or Elementary stream.

cervPidRemapTimeActivated.name: cervPidRemapTimeActivated
cervPidRemapTimeActivated.description: The value of sysUpTime when this PID was last activated. Zero if not-applicable.

cervPidRemapTimeActive.name: cervPidRemapTimeActive
cervPidRemapTimeActive.description: The total time that the PID has been active.

cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexTable.name: cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexTable
cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexTable.description: This table maps the TsIndex of an outgoing Transport Stream on a QAM channel to the ifIndex for that channel. The Transport Stream is assumed to be an 'outgoing' one.

cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexEntry.name: cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexEntry
cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToIfIndexEntry.description: TSID to QAM channel mapping table

cervLookupTsIndexIfIndex.name: cervLookupTsIndexIfIndex
cervLookupTsIndexIfIndex.description: The ifIndex for the QAM channel transmitting this TransportStreamIndex.

cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibInde.name: cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibIndexTable
cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibInde.description: This table maps the TransportStreamIndex of a Transport Stream on a QAM channel to the corresponding incoming TransportStreamIndexes. cervTsMibIndex - an outgoing Transport Stream cervInTsMibIndex - the corresponding incoming Transport Stream.

cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibInde.name: cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibIndexEntry
cerVideoLookupQamTsMibIndexToInTsMibInde.description: TSID to incoming transport stream mapping table

cervLookupInTsMibIndex.name: cervLookupInTsMibIndex
cervLookupInTsMibIndex.description: MIB TsIndex for an incoming transport stream(IP).

cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpTable.name: cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpTable
cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpTable.description: This table maps the TransportStreamIndex of an incoming Transport Stream to the IP address and UDP port for that Transport Stream.

cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpEntry.name: cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpEntry
cerVideoLookupTsMibIndexToUdpIpEntry.description: TSID to IP address and port mapping table

cervLookupTsMibIndexUdpPort.name: cervLookupTsMibIndexUdpPort
cervLookupTsMibIndexUdpPort.description: The UDP receiving the Transport Stream for TransportStreamIndex.

cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrDest.name: cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrDest
cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrDest.description: The DEST IP address receiving the Transport Stream for TransportStreamIndex.

cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrSrc.name: cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrSrc
cervLookupTsMibIndexIpAddrSrc.description: The SRC IP address receiving the Transport Stream for TransportStreamIndex.

cerVirtualEdgeTable.name: cerVirtualEdgeTable
cerVirtualEdgeTable.description: This table stores parameters for each Virtual Edge video object.

cerveIndex.name: cerveIndex
cerveIndex.description: The index of the Virtual Edge. Although not officially supported, allow a VE for each of 12 DCAMs.

cerveName.name: cerveName
cerveName.description: This is the name of the Virtual Edge.

cervePortMap.name: cervePortMap
cervePortMap.description: Only 8x8 and session is currently supported. Ignored for sdv-only channels. Manual mapping, where individual streams manually configured to map to channela in this VE are forwarded, may in the future be supported in addition to those allowed by this element.

cerveSzIndex.name: cerveSzIndex
cerveSzIndex.description: Index of Streaming Zone used by this Virtual Edge. Multiple Virtual Edges may have the same SZ. Zero means unassigned.

cerveGlobal.name: cerveGlobal
cerveGlobal.description: Whether or not this VE spans all DCAMs. Can only be set when the row is created.

cerveAdminState.name: cerveAdminState
cerveAdminState.description: Setting the VE AdminState to down blocks all video traffic to all video channels in the VE. It also takes down any ERM connection to the VE. It does not change the channel state of the channels in the VE.

cerveRowStatus.name: cerveRowStatus
cerveRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table. Allowed values are createAndGo, destroy, and active.

cerveStatusTable.name: cerveStatusTable
cerveStatusTable.description: This table stores statistics for each Virtual Edge video object.

cerveStatusDroppedPkts.name: cerveStatusDroppedPkts
cerveStatusDroppedPkts.description: Number of incoming UDP packets to one of this VE's data plane addresses whose DPORT was not currently valid and was therefore dropped by the NPU.

cerveStatusBlockedPkts.name: cerveStatusBlockedPkts
cerveStatusBlockedPkts.description: Number of incoming UDP packets whose DPORT was in the valid subrange, but whose DPORT was on the blocked list, so the packet was dropped by the NPU.

cerveStatusFragmentedPkts.name: cerveStatusFragmentedPkts
cerveStatusFragmentedPkts.description: Number of incoming UDP packets with a valid DIP and DPORT, but were dropped by the NPU because they were fragmented.

cerveStatusOperStatus.name: cerveStatusOperStatus
cerveStatusOperStatus.description: Whether the VE is operationally IS or OOS. It is IS if any channel in the VE is IS.

cerveErmSrvDiscTable.name: cerveErmSrvDiscTable
cerveErmSrvDiscTable.description: This table stores parameters for each Virtual Edge video ERM object, if defined.

cerveErmSrvDiscEntry.name: cerveErmSrvDiscEntry
cerveErmSrvDiscEntry.description: Virtual Edge ERM configuration parameter table

cerveErmSrvDiscErmIndex.name: cerveErmSrvDiscErmIndex
cerveErmSrvDiscErmIndex.description: This is the ERM used for this Virtual Edge. Multiple VEs may use same ERM. Zero means unassigned.

cerveErmSrvDiscComponentName.name: cerveErmSrvDiscComponentName
cerveErmSrvDiscComponentName.description: The ERM component name used on the service discovery interface, which is unique per VE.

cerveErmSrvDiscAdminState.name: cerveErmSrvDiscAdminState
cerveErmSrvDiscAdminState.description: Whether or not the VE servicediscovery interface is enabled.

cerveErmSrvDiscControlIpAddr.name: cerveErmSrvDiscControlIpAddr
cerveErmSrvDiscControlIpAddr.description: This is the source loopback address used when communicating with the ERM and for receiving messages from the ERM.

cerveErmSrvDiscControlIfIndex.name: cerveErmSrvDiscControlIfIndex
cerveErmSrvDiscControlIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the loopback interface for communicating with an ERM.

cerveErmSrvDiscRowStatus.name: cerveErmSrvDiscRowStatus
cerveErmSrvDiscRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table. Allowed values are createAndGo, destroy, and active.

cerveErmD6StatTable.name: cerveErmD6StatTable
cerveErmD6StatTable.description: This table stores ERM NGOD D6 statistics for each Virtual Edge video object. A row in this table is autocreated when a row in the cerveErmSvcDiscTable is Created and cervErmProtocol is set to ngod. Another status table would be added in the future when we support cervErmProtocol nmi.

cerveErmD6StatTcpConnSuccess.name: cerveErmD6StatTcpConnSuccess
cerveErmD6StatTcpConnSuccess.description: Number of successful TCP connections to ERM.

cerveErmD6StatTcpConnFail.name: cerveErmD6StatTcpConnFail
cerveErmD6StatTcpConnFail.description: Number of failed attempts to create a TCP connection to the ERM.

cerveErmD6StatVrepEstablishTime.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepEstablishTime
cerveErmD6StatVrepEstablishTime.description: Timestamp when last VREP Establish state was reached with ERM.

cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenSent.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenSent
cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenSent.description: Number of VREP OPEN messages sent to ERM

cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenRcvd.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenRcvd
cerveErmD6StatVrepOpenRcvd.description: Number of VREP OPEN messages received from ERM

cerveErmD6StatUpdsSent.name: cerveErmD6StatUpdsSent
cerveErmD6StatUpdsSent.description: Number of VREP UPDATE messages sent to ERM.

cerveErmD6StatUpdsRcvd.name: cerveErmD6StatUpdsRcvd
cerveErmD6StatUpdsRcvd.description: Number of VREP UPDATE messages received from ERM.

cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveSent.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveSent
cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveSent.description: Number of Keep Alive messages sent to ERM.

cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveRcvd.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveRcvd
cerveErmD6StatVrepKeepAliveRcvd.description: Number of Keep Alive messages received from ERM.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteSzName.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteSzName
cerveErmD6StatRemoteSzName.description: Contains the Streaming Zone name from the ERM.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteCompName.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteCompName
cerveErmD6StatRemoteCompName.description: Contains the component name from the ERM.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepId.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepId
cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepId.description: Contains VREP ID at the ERM.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepVersion.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepVersion
cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepVersion.description: Contains VREP version at the ERM.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepRoutes.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepRoutes
cerveErmD6StatRemoteVrepRoutes.description: Contains the number of active routes from the ERM for this VE.

cerveErmD6StatRemoteHoldTime.name: cerveErmD6StatRemoteHoldTime
cerveErmD6StatRemoteHoldTime.description: Contains VREP/DRRP hold-time in seconds from the ERM for connection timeout. Zero means do not time-out.

cerveErmD6StatVrepStatus.name: cerveErmD6StatVrepStatus
cerveErmD6StatVrepStatus.description: The current state of the VREP state machine (the D6 TCP connection to the ERM).

cerveDataAddrMapTable.name: cerveDataAddrMapTable
cerveDataAddrMapTable.description: This table contains the data plane addresses for the VE objects.

cerveDataAddrMapEntry.name: cerveDataAddrMapEntry
cerveDataAddrMapEntry.description: Dataplane IP addresses to virtual edge mapping table

cerveDataAddrMapIpAddr.name: cerveDataAddrMapIpAddr
cerveDataAddrMapIpAddr.description: This a data plane address for the VE. All UDP packets to this address are port-mapped.

cerveDataAddrMapIfIndex.name: cerveDataAddrMapIfIndex
cerveDataAddrMapIfIndex.description: The ifIndex of the loopback interface used to assign the dataplane address.

cerveDataAddrMapEdgeInputGrp.name: cerveDataAddrMapEdgeInputGrp
cerveDataAddrMapEdgeInputGrp.description: The edge input group for reporting to RAMSDEN.

cerveDataAddrMapErmInputPort.name: cerveDataAddrMapErmInputPort
cerveDataAddrMapErmInputPort.description: The input port number used by the ERM for session-based VOD port mapping. Zero means no value is set.

cerveDataAddrMapRowStatus.name: cerveDataAddrMapRowStatus
cerveDataAddrMapRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table. Allowed values are createAndGo, destroy, and active.

cerveInputPortTable.name: cerveInputPortTable
cerveInputPortTable.description: This table maps the session-based VOD input port number to a dataplane address.

cerveInputPortEntry.name: cerveInputPortEntry
cerveInputPortEntry.description: Input port number to a dataplane address mapping table

cerveInputPortErmInputPort.name: cerveInputPortErmInputPort
cerveInputPortErmInputPort.description: The input port number used by the ERM for session-based VOD port mapping. Zero means no value is set.

cerveInputPortIpAddr.name: cerveInputPortIpAddr
cerveInputPortIpAddr.description: This a data plane address for the VE. All UDP packets to this address are port-mapped.

cerveUdpPortMapTable.name: cerveUdpPortMapTable
cerveUdpPortMapTable.description: This table contains the blocks of UDP ports in a VE that are currently mapped to a Qam channel. This table is only used when cervePortMap is set to 8x8 or 10x6.

cerveUdpPortMapEntry.name: cerveUdpPortMapEntry
cerveUdpPortMapEntry.description: UDP port to QAM channel mapping table

cerveUdpPortMapUdpBasePort.name: cerveUdpPortMapUdpBasePort
cerveUdpPortMapUdpBasePort.description: This is the lowest port number in the block of UDP ports mapped to this QAM channel. The total number of UDP ports in this block depends on the type of port map used for this VE; if the map is type map8x8, then there are 256 ports in the block and the upper eight bits are the UDP block ID. If it is type type map10x6, then there are 64 ports in the block, and the upper six bits are the block ID.

cerveUdpPortMapQamIfIndex.name: cerveUdpPortMapQamIfIndex
cerveUdpPortMapQamIfIndex.description: This is the ifIndex of the QAM channel to which this block of UDP ports maps. Is unique among all rows in the table.

cerveBandwidthTable.name: cerveBandwidthTable
cerveBandwidthTable.description: This table describes the bandwidth on NSI links belonging to this virtual edge (for reporting To an ERM).

cerveBandwidthEntry.name: cerveBandwidthEntry
cerveBandwidthEntry.description: Bandwidth allocation configuration for a virtual edge

cerveBandIpAddr.name: cerveBandIpAddr
cerveBandIpAddr.description: This a data plane address for the Virtual Edge being assigned this bandwidth. Must be an address already assigned to the VE.

cerveBandIfIndex.name: cerveBandIfIndex
cerveBandIfIndex.description: This is the ifIndex of the ethernet or link-aggregate interface for the interface whose bandwidth is being assigned to this VE.

cerveBandAllocation.name: cerveBandAllocation
cerveBandAllocation.description: The amount of bandwidth in Kbps of the NSI interface to be reported for the VE over the service discovery ERM connection.

cerveBandRowStatus.name: cerveBandRowStatus
cerveBandRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table.

cerveUdpBlockedPortTable.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortTable
cerveUdpBlockedPortTable.description: A row in this table contains the a range of one or more UDP ports, where any ingress UDP stream with a port in this range to any of the VE dataplane addresses must be dropped. This table only applies to table-based VOD streams.

cerveUdpBlockedPortEntry.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortEntry
cerveUdpBlockedPortEntry.description: Blocked UDP port mapping for a virtual edge

cerveUdpBlockedPortIpAddr.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortIpAddr
cerveUdpBlockedPortIpAddr.description: This a data plane address for the Virtual Edge where the UDP is being blocked. Must be an address already assigned to the VE or 0.0.0.0, which means that the port is blocked for every VE dataplane address.

cerveUdpBlockedPortLowPort.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortLowPort
cerveUdpBlockedPortLowPort.description: This is the low port number to be blocked for the VE.

cerveUdpBlockedPortHighPort.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortHighPort
cerveUdpBlockedPortHighPort.description: This is the high port number to be blocked. Is same as low port if only a one port range.

cerveUdpBlockedPortRowStatus.name: cerveUdpBlockedPortRowStatus
cerveUdpBlockedPortRowStatus.description: The RowStatus for controlling entries in this table. Allowed values are createAndGo, destroy, and active.

cerErmSrvDiscTable.name: cerErmSrvDiscTable
cerErmSrvDiscTable.description: This table describes the configuration parameters associated with remote Edge Resource Manager (ERM) devices. Use of multiple entries within this table enables the logical separation of the Cer to multiple ERMs.

cerErmSrvDiscEntry.name: cerErmSrvDiscEntry
cerErmSrvDiscEntry.description: An entry corresponds to an individual ERM configuration.

cerErmSrvDiscDescription.name: cerErmSrvDiscDescription
cerErmSrvDiscDescription.description: Contains text description of the ERM configuration.

cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr.name: cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr
cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr.description: The ERM remote address. An IPv4 address or hostname is acceptable as an address.

cerErmSrvDiscRemoteFqdnIpAddr.name: cerErmSrvDiscRemoteFqdnIpAddr
cerErmSrvDiscRemoteFqdnIpAddr.description: The IP address for an FQDN in cerErmRemoteIpName. This is 0.0.0.0 if cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr is an IPv4 address.

cerErmSrvDiscPort.name: cerErmSrvDiscPort
cerErmSrvDiscPort.description: Contains TCP port value used for DRRP listener/connections.

cerErmSrvDiscHoldTime.name: cerErmSrvDiscHoldTime
cerErmSrvDiscHoldTime.description: Contains VREP/DRRP hold-time in seconds for connection timeout

cerErmSrvDiscKeepAliveTime.name: cerErmSrvDiscKeepAliveTime
cerErmSrvDiscKeepAliveTime.description: Contains VREP/DRRP interval in seconds for sending keep-alive messages. Must be less than cerErmHoldTime.

cerErmSrvDiscBwInterval.name: cerErmSrvDiscBwInterval
cerErmSrvDiscBwInterval.description: Interval in seconds to send AvailableBandwidth UDPATE messages. Zero means no reporting of bandwidth.

cerErmSrvDiscBwThreshold.name: cerErmSrvDiscBwThreshold
cerErmSrvDiscBwThreshold.description: Change in bandwith utilisation in Kbps required to trigger an AvailableBandwidth UDPATE messages.

cerErmSrvDiscCost.name: cerErmSrvDiscCost
cerErmSrvDiscCost.description: Cost to advertise in VREP OPEN message.

cerErmSrvDiscConnRetryTimeout.name: cerErmSrvDiscConnRetryTimeout
cerErmSrvDiscConnRetryTimeout.description: The maximum time to wait before retrying establishing the ERM connection.

cerErmSrvDiscRowStatus.name: cerErmSrvDiscRowStatus
cerErmSrvDiscRowStatus.description: The values that control the creation/deletion of ERMs on the CER.

cerStreamingZoneTable.name: cerStreamingZoneTable
cerStreamingZoneTable.description: Table mapping a streaming zone index to a streaming zone name. Duplicate TSIDs must be in different SZs. Each VE is in one SZ.

cerStreamingZoneEntry.name: cerStreamingZoneEntry
cerStreamingZoneEntry.description: Table mapping a streaming zone index to a streaming zone name.

cervSzIndex.name: cervSzIndex
cervSzIndex.description: MIB Index for a streaming zone.

cervSzQamNetworkId.name: cervSzQamNetworkId
cervSzQamNetworkId.description: Network ID for a streaming zone. Must be unique for all streaming zones. Zero means not set.

cervSzName.name: cervSzName
cervSzName.description: Configured name of the streaming zone.

cervSzVpmeSdIndex.name: cervSzVpmeSdIndex
cervSzVpmeSdIndex.description: The security-domain instance number uniquely identifies the VPME instance for the E6000. Zero means no SD is assigned.

cervSzRowStatus.name: cervSzRowStatus
cervSzRowStatus.description: The values that control the creation/deletion of streaming zones on the CER.

cerVideoCountsTable.name: cerVideoCountsTable
cerVideoCountsTable.description: This table stores IEQ video counts for each DCAM.

cerVideoCountsCardId.name: cerVideoCountsCardId
cerVideoCountsCardId.description: This the slot number of DCAM doing the counts.

cerVideoCountsBadSyncPkts.name: cerVideoCountsBadSyncPkts
cerVideoCountsBadSyncPkts.description: Number of incoming port-mapped UDP packets dropped because of not containing valid MPEG.

cerVideoCountsDroppedPkts.name: cerVideoCountsDroppedPkts
cerVideoCountsDroppedPkts.description: Number of valid incoming MPEG packets that were were dropped by the DCAM because of a program number conflict, oversubscription condition, or MPTS pass-thru conflict.

cerVideoCountsFragments.name: cerVideoCountsFragments
cerVideoCountsFragments.description: Number of multicast packet fragments dropped in the DCAM.

cerVideoErrorStr.name: cerVideoErrorStr
cerVideoErrorStr.description: Description of error encountered on the ERM interface.

cerVideoSrvDiscErmConnection.name: cerVideoSrvDiscErmConnection
cerVideoSrvDiscErmConnection.description: This trap is sent when the Service Discovery ERM connection fails. This can occur for a number of reasons, the Virtual Edge may not be able to successfully establish the connection, the OPEN message negotiation may fail, the ERM may closed the connection, the Hold Time may expire, a NOTIFICATION message may be received, etc.

cerVideoStreamFailure.name: cerVideoStreamFailure
cerVideoStreamFailure.description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects a problem with the incoming video stream. This can be a problem parsing a PAT or PMT in the stream, a jitter buffer underflow or overflow, non-MPEG data on the stream.

cerVideoServiceFailure.name: cerVideoServiceFailure
cerVideoServiceFailure.description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects a problem with forwarding an incoming stream to a QAM channel. This can be as a result of the UDP port being blocked, there is no matching UDP port on an IS QAM channel, the potential of creating a program number conflict on the QAM channel, the program number limit has been reached on the QAM channel, etc.

cerVideoQamOversubscription.name: cerVideoQamOversubscription
cerVideoQamOversubscription.description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects oversubscription on a QAM channel and has taken corrective action.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 15:02:14 2021
On host samy-ThinkPad-T495s platform Linux version 5.8.0-50-generic by user root
